text: Alfred Kleinschwärzer (born 23 March 1960 in Rosenheim, Germany) is a German martial artist, former law enforcement officer, and security expert. He is known for his extensive career in federal police service, international diplomatic security, martial arts instruction, and professional training in defensive tactics. He currently serves as the President of the Bundesfachverband für Sicherheit und Selbstverteidigung e.V. (BfSD e.V.) and is the founder of ALEX – Agency for Law Enforcement Xperts. https://www.ovb- heimatzeitungen.de/gesamt-sport/2017/10/13/10-dan-fuer-kleinschwaerzer.ovb https://www.kick24.info/reports/freddy-kleinschwarzer https://kalscheuer.com/aktuelles/2024/11/26/selbstbewusstsein-staerken/ https://www.blick-aktuell.de/Andernach/Selbstverteidigung-der- Extraklasse-49958.html https://www.cosmopolitan.de/frauen-in-angst-jetzt- reichts-diese-dinge-muss-sich-keine-frau-gefallen-lassen-78955.html https://www.mainpost.de/sport/wuerzburg/ju-jutsu-geburtstag-in-wuerzburg- art-6934487 https://www.kurier.de/inhalt.selbstverteidigung-10-notfall- tools.6435bbaa-4f5f-4a56-b6a0-3dacd852b661.html https://www.bfsd.group/ ==Early Life and Education== Kleinschwärzer was born and raised in Rosenheim, Bavaria. He began training in martial arts at an early age, starting with Judo in 1973. In the following years, he expanded his practice to include Karate (1974), Taekwondo (1976), and Kun-Tai-Ko (1977). This early dedication to martial disciplines formed the basis for a lifelong commitment to physical training, personal development, and instruction. https://www.medimops.de/alfred-kleinschwaerzer-100-zitate-weisheiten-by- alfred-kleinschwaerzer-gesammelte-weisheiten-zu-den-themen-leben-liebe-budo- sport-motivation- taschenbuch-M0B089M2J5TC.html?srsltid=AfmBOopseRWiQXvFotD5WYPvXgDr7qD1f7b9sO2YX3s_ML0ruF2NhMYO https://kellner-wie-der-ober.podigee.io/19-new-episode ==Career in Law Enforcement and International Security== In 1979, Kleinschwärzer entered federal service by joining the Bundesgrenzschutz (Federal Border Guard), which later became the Bundespolizei (Federal Police). Over a career spanning more than four decades, he held numerous national and international assignments related to security and police training. Following advanced training through the Bundeskriminalamt (BKA), the German Foreign Office (AA), and the elite counter-terrorism unit GSG 9, Kleinschwärzer took on various diplomatic security roles abroad. His first posting came in 1992 as chief of security at the German Embassy in Dublin. This was followed by assignments in Beijing (1993), Ankara (1999), and Prague (2008). In between these postings, he worked with the United Nations in Kosovo, where he served as head of training at the Kosovo Police Service School in Vushtrri (2004–2005), focusing on police defensive tactics. In 2010, he joined the European Union Monitoring Mission (EUMM) in Georgia as a patrol leader with the Delta Team. Domestically, he held key instructional roles, including at the Federal Police Academy in Lübeck (2007–2008) and later as a police trainer at the Federal Police Directorate in Munich, responsible for training coordination across 11 departments in southern Germany. He is a multiple titleholder, including: • World Kickboxing Champion • European Kickboxing Champion • Five-time winner at the World Martial Arts Games He is licensed by the Deutscher Olympischer Sportbund (DOSB) as a general sports instructor and specialist coach in Kickboxing and Karate. In addition to competitive success, he has devoted considerable time to teaching and developing self-defense programs for people of all ages and backgrounds. He regularly works with children, youth, and adults, aiming to foster discipline, respect, and self-confidence.
